Reviews.Content: Nice room but poor customer service Rooms were very nice  renovated (contrary to other remarks). Could not get room until my wife arrived at airport several hours later. Refrigerator was unvailable for several days despite promises and was getting the runaround from the Front Desk. Also there were always things missing in the bathroom such as facecloths and amenities.
Reviews.Author: AZFrequent_Traveler

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Staff The location is convenient off I-35 on Market Center. We arrived about 2:30 pm  had to wait for our rooms to be ready. The staff is cordial  friendly but did not honor the rate I was quoted when reservations were made several weeks in advance. The hotel is older and has been remodeled; however, the bathrooms are very clean but small. A coffee maker with coffee and tea was available in the bathroom, along with plenty of complimentary bath items (shampoo, lotion, etc.) The rooms are a bit cozier than I am used to, especially for this class of hotel, but they were well-appointed with new furnishings and bedding. The beds are ultra-comfortable and extra pillows were already in the room when we arrived. The rooms were nicely sound-proofed, even noise in the hall was hard to detect.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A little scary The hotel quality was okay, but the location is a little iffy. There were police cars in the parking lot twice while we were there. The downstairs lobby is nicely decorated with beautiful fresh flowers, but other than that, the rooms and other areas are just average at best.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Disappointing I was very disappointed with my stay. My room was on the top (11th) floor, directly across from the elevators and very small, just large enough for a queen bed (most rooms, judging by the floor plan, are larger). The worst thing, though, was there was an intermittent rattling/rustling noise in the ceiling over my room. I thought it was mechanical; the hotel staff said they thought it was a trapped bird and promised to do something about it. They said they were completely full and couldn't move me to another room. The noise persisted for my three-night stay. It didn't keep me awake at night, but it was annoying. Aside from that, the room was very clean, bedding was comfortable, the bathroom was small but nice, internet and long distance were free if you are a Wyndham by request member. I stayed at the Anatole next door a year ago and I would definitely stay there instead. I would also say, if you're like me and like to walk, don't stay in Market Center at all. It is nearly impossible to walk anywhere in this industrial/warehouse area up against a busy freeway.
Reviews.Author: Steve0296

Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, but nothing to do nearby This hotel was fine for business travel - the room was an ok size and nicely furnished (although the bathroom was tiny). The worst thing about it was the location - alongside a highway with other hotels, and there were no restaurants (except a Denny's), shops or anything intersting to walk to. So if you're looking for a hotel in an interesting or fun part of town, this is not it!
Reviews.Author: hocomogirl

Reviews.Content: Okay, but not much better I chose this hotel because everything else near downtown was booked or exorbitant. The price was right and the room was clean. But I can't say much else that is positive. The staff was less than attentive. The bar is tiny and there really isn't much around. There was a lot of noise from the parking lot and whenever the water was running in the room next door, there was a lot of noise in my room.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very Disappointed My husband and I just returned from the Wyndham Market Center and I must say that I am extremely disappointed. A few of the previous posts refer to this property as a 鈥渓uxury鈥?property and that鈥檚 not even close to being true. While the public areas in this hotel are quite nice the rooms fall short of that description. First of all, the rooms are very small and the bathroom was extremely tiny. So tiny, in fact that only one person could be in there at a time and even then it was difficult to turn around without hitting your arm on something. The ceiling was so low that my husband (he鈥檚 6鈥?3鈥? only had about 3 inches of clearance above his head and practically had to bend over to use the shower head. On top of that, our tub didn鈥檛 drain properly so by the end of our shower, we were standing in a decent amount of water. There was a strand of hair in our clean towels and the washcloths were so thin you could see your fingers through them and one of them even had a few small holes in it. The floors were old and cracked and there were a few spots in the walls and floors of the bathroom that desperately needed caulking. The door knob looked that it had been removed and when it was replaced they left a space between the hole and the handle so you could see through it to the room (sure it was only about an inch wide but come on, I wouldn鈥檛 even expect to see this at a two star property). There were also a ton of scratches on the door like someone had had to claw their way out. The d茅cor in the room was nice but there wasn鈥檛 even an enclosed closet. The closet was a bar set up right inside the door with a few hangers. I can鈥檛 tell you the last time I was at a property that didn鈥檛 even have a true closet. On top of that the walls were so thin you could hear the conversations of the guests in the next room. One morning I was treated to a business phone call and the next night I got to hear a drunken man talk to his family. Talk about a real treat! One of the light bulbs needed replacing and the clock was set for the wrong time. Instead of showing 6 a.m., it showed 6 p.m. which meant the alarm didn鈥檛 go off the first morning we were there. I realize all of these seem like insignificant issues but when you鈥檙e confronted with all of them in a short time period, they definitely add up.The service at this property was about half and half鈥alf was great and the other half just average. The food we got from room service for lunch one day was really good and our service was fantastic. However, the next morning our experience wasn鈥檛 quite as good. We needed directions a few times during our stay and each time we were given impeccable directions and were given service with a smile. I use this website a lot and usually rave about a property; unfortunately this is not one of those times.
Reviews.Author: tarheelgirl03

Reviews.Content: Great hotel! I decided to stay here instead of the Anatole next store.The room was small but very nice and clean the service was awesome best hamburger i have ever had for room service the breakfast was also very good and i am very picky about my food.The hotel is small but that's what I wanted it was a very good experiance and I will always stay there when i travel to Dallas. You really get alot for your money. This was a classy place.
Reviews.Author: FStinnett

Reviews.Content: A real bargain We originally booked at the Best Western Market Center based on the great reviews on this site. We normally don't stay in motels, but my wife and I decided to give it a shot. However, upon checking in, we were dissapointed and decided to hunt around for another hotel. For only twenty dollars more (80 dollars a night) we found the Wyndham Market Center right next door. Wow!! This is simply the best hotel bargain I've ever seen. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are very nice. I have stayed in hotels that were double the price that weren't as nice. The rooms are what you would expect from a $150.00+ a night room. I find the Wyndham Anatole (right near this hotel) to be a gargantuan monstrosity. If you are looking for a smaller cozy luxury hotel that won't break the bank in Dallas this is the real deal. Keep in mind that this is not the best part of town, but it is very close the best parts of town.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Pass on this place. Stay at the Anatole I book events in upwards of forty hotels per year. I am committed that my attendees have an extraordinary experience, so I aim for 4 diamond properties, but due to availability, I sometimes have to settle for 3 diamond. I have been to many an excellent 3 diamond. This was certainly not one of them. My customers had an extraordinary experience, all right. Extraordinarily lousy!When I arrived I was informed that the hotel was oversold and that 30% of my customers (all of whom had reservations) were to be bumped to another hotel, a 2 diamond next door. Okay, so these things sometimes happen. What upset me, though, is that I later discovered that the hotel had known of the situation 3 weeks earlier and, although I was in weekly contact with them, I was never informed of the problem. Had I been so informed I could have made arrangements with the Hotel next door (which is owned by a friend of mine) to at least have gotten my customers into their recently renovated rooms. As it was, they ended up in the last remaining rooms, and I got complaints from every single one of the bumped.I was at the front desk as 6 of my attendees were trying to check in. They were told, with no explanation, that they would have to stay elsewhere and they were understandably upset. The front desk staff clearly had no training whatsoever in communication and customer service. I had to step in to explain and apologize for the situation.As for the next two days, the hotel never did perform in a way that would redeem itself in my eyes.I am actually shocked that the Wyndham Anatole next door (a fabulous hotel) doesn't lobby to have the Wyndham flag taken away from this sad excuse for a hotel.
Reviews.Author: Seattle_planner

Reviews.Content: Gutes Hotel in guenstiger Lage mit gutem Fruehstueck   showReview(17446464, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=
